TYPE SMC_ERROR :
The enumeration
SMC_ERROR
contains all error numbers that can be returned by SoftMotion function blocks.
SMC_ErrorString
generates an error string output.

try to reduce the dynamics on the path and / or the dynamics when entering CP-Tracking.

independently from the axis group (single axis movement or similar).

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_INVERSE_TRAFO_EXCEEDING_POSLIMITS

(MC_GroupInterrupt not called / non-resumable axis group error)

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_INVALID_INTERRUPT_POSITION
rows.Comment: The commanded interrupt position is invalid.

rows.Name: SMC_RELATIVE_MOVEMENT_TRACKING_CS

Its start position (end position of preceding movement) and distance are given
in two different coordinate systems (CS) with at least one being dynamic

rows.Name: SMC_RELATIVE_MOVEMENT_ABORTING_TRACKING
rows.Comment:
The commanded relative movement is not supported.
It is Aborting and aborts a
- track-in (from a static CS to a dynamic CS),
- track-out (from a dynamic CS to a static CS) or
- re-track (from a dynamic CS to another dynamic CS) movement.

rows.Name: SMC_CIRCULAR_MOVEMENT_TRACKING_CS
rows.Comment:
The commanded circular movement is not supported.
Its start position (end position of preceding movement) and target
position are given in two different coordinate systems (CS) with at
least one being dynamic.

rows.Name: SMC_CIRCULAR_MOVEMENT_ABORTING_TRACKING_CS
rows.Comment:
The commanded aborting circular movement is not supported.
Its start position (current position) and target position are given in two
different coordinate systems (CS) with at least one being dynamic, or
the aborted movement is PTP tracking.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_CONTINUE_POSITION_WRONG_CHECKSUM
rows.Comment:
The checksum of the continue position is wrong.
The continue position either was not written by MC_GroupInterrupt,
was modified afterwards, or an online change was executed when the
continue position was still in use.
Please note: The checksum is only checked when the continue position
cannot be expressed as a constant value, because it changes with time
(e.g. when a track in movement should be continued).

rows.Name: SMC_CIRCULAR_TRACKING_TOOL_CHANGE_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
A circular movement with a tool change is only supported in a static
coordinate system.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_COULD_NOT_WRITE_CONTINUE_DATA
rows.Comment:
Continue data could not be written.  This can happen when
trying to write continue data while moving to another continue
position.

A modulo axis is not allowed for joints of the kinematics
that are not rotary.

rows.Name: SMC_MODULO_AXIS_FOR_LIMITED_ROTARY_JOINT

A modulo axis is not allowed for rotary joints that have a limited
range. (The range comes from the kinematic transformation.)

rows.Name: SMC_MODULO_AXIS_PERIOD_NOT_360
rows.Comment:
A modulo axis for a rotary joint must have modulo period

rows.Name: SMC_FB_WASNT_CALLED_DURING_EXECUTION

rows.Name: SMC_NO_EVALUATION_POSSIBLE_FOR_TIME_OFFSET

rows.Comment: Invalid time offset. Must be >=0.

rows.Name: SMC_TIME_OFFSET_TOO_LARGE

duration, see SMC_TuneCPKernel.fPlanningForecastDuration).

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_NUM_ADDITIONAL_AXES_EXCEEDED

The maximum number of additional axes can be increased by changing the library
parameterMAX_NUM_ADDITIONAL_AXES``in``SM3_CPKernelDefaults.

coordinate system.

rows.Name: SMC_KERNEL_PTP_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the kernel

rows.Name: SMC_KERNEL_PTP_INVALID_TASKCYCLETIME
rows.Comment: Task cycle time not positive

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_INVALID_PARAMETERS
rows.Comment: The parameter values of the transformation are invalid.

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_INVALID_CONSTELLATION
rows.Comment:
The requested position is outside of the working area of the
transformation.

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_INVALID_COUPLING
rows.Comment:
The orientation part cannot work together with the position part of
the kinematics.
Either, the position part doesnât implement ISMPositionKinematics2,
or the orientation cannot deal with the position partâs image of
orientations.

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_NOT_INITIALIZED
rows.Comment:
The FB implements ISMKinematicWithInitialization, but hasnât been
Initialized yet.

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_NO_TOOL_WITH_OFFSET_ALLOWED
rows.Comment:
Special error for positioning part of Kin_4Axis_Palletizer,
which implements ISMPositionKinematics_Offset2, but cannot
actually cope with offsets <> 0.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_TOOL_OFFSET_INCOMPATIBLE_WITH_KINEMATICS
rows.Comment:
The configured tool offset is not compatible with the
kinematics used

rows.Name: SMC_TRAFO_INVALID_AXIS_LIMITS
rows.Comment:
The configured position limits of one or more axes are not
valid for the kinematics.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_PATH_DEVIATION_TOO_HIGH
rows.Comment:
This error code has been replaced by SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_AXIS_LAG_EXCEEDED,
SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_POSITION_LAG_EXCEEDED and SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_ORIENTATION_LAG_EXCEEDED.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_POSITION_EXCEEDS_POSLIMITS
rows.Comment:
The given axis position exceeds the position limits of an
axis.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_NO_DYNAMIC_MODEL_CONFIGURED
rows.Comment: No dynamic model has been configured for the axis group.

rows.Name: SMC_DYNAMICS_NUM_TORQUES_NEQ_NUM_AXES
rows.Comment:
The number of torques returned by the dynamic model is different from the
number of axes.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_AXIS_LAG_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment:
The axis lag is higher than the allowed tolerance.
When tracking is used, this indicates that the tracked object is accelerating/
decelerating too quickly for the robot to follow.
SeeSMC_SetPathTolerance.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_POSITION_LAG_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment:
The position lag of the TCP is higher than the allowed tolerance.
When tracking is used, this indicates that the tracked object is accelerating/
decelerating too quickly for the robot to follow.
SeeSMC_SetPathTolerance.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_MAX_ORIENTATION_LAG_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment:
The orientation lag of the TCP is higher than the allowed tolerance.
When tracking is used, this indicates that the tracked object is accelerating/
decelerating too quickly for the robot to follow.
SeeSMC_SetPathTolerance.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CACHE_FULL
rows.Comment: The cache of the CP planner is too small.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_EVAL_ERROR
rows.Comment:
The evaluation of the position on a path element failed
(internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_NON_CONTINUABLE_STATE
rows.Comment: Non-continuable state reached (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_MAX_LENGTH_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Maximum trajectory length exceeded (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ACCELERATION_TOO_HIGH
rows.Comment: Path acceleration too high (invalid state, internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_MAX_ITERATIONS_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment: Maximum number of iterations exceeded (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_NO_TRAJECTORY
rows.Comment: No trajectory could be computed (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_OUT_QUEUE_FULL
rows.Comment: The out-queue is full (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_QUEUE_UNDERRUN
rows.Comment:
The computation of the trajectory could not be performed in real time.
The fill level of the sync buffer between the planning task and the bus
task was too low.Possible reasons:The task configuration of the planning task is not set correctly.
Please see the online help chapter âDiagnosis of Problems with
Movementsâ for good settings.The performance of the PLC is not sufficient.
Possible measures to avoid the error:use a separate, dedicated CPU core for the planning taskincrease the bus task intervalincrease the planning interval and/or the sync buffer
duration usingSMC_TuneCPKernelThe current fill level of the sync buffer can be monitored using
theCurrentSyncBufferDurationouptput ofMC_GroupReadStatus.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_QUEUE
rows.Comment: Invalid queue (invalid size or pointer)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_BLENDING_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: An internal error occurred while blending two CP movements

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CIRCLE_COLLINEAR_POINTS
rows.Comment: The three points that define the circle are collinear.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CIRCLE_CENTER_NOT_ON_BISECTOR
rows.Comment:
The center point is not on the perpendicular bisector of the
start and end point.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CIRCLE_RADIUS_ZERO
rows.Comment: The radius is zero

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CIRCLE_DISTANCE_LARGER_THAN_DIAMETER
rows.Comment:
The distance between start and end point is larger than the diameter.
(When trying to create a circle usingSMC_Circ_Mode.Radius.)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CIRCLE_START_AND_ENDPOINT_EQUAL
rows.Comment:
The start and end point are equal
(SMC_Circ_Mode.Radius).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_BLENDING_DEGENERATE_SPLINE
rows.Comment: The blending spline is degenerate (too short or non-regular)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ELEMENT_TOO_SHORT
rows.Comment: The path element cannot be created because it is too short.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_COULD_NOT_CUT_PATH
rows.Comment:
The path could not be cut for aborting movement (internal
error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_ANGULAR_VEL_ACC
rows.Comment:
The given angular velocity or acceleration is invalid (quaternion with
non-zero real part, internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_ORIENTATION
rows.Comment:
The given orientation is invalid (non-orthonormal matrix or non-unit
quaternion, internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_TIME_BUDGET_EXCEEDED
rows.Comment:
The given time budget for the computation is exceeded
(internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_AXIS_LIMIT_VIOLATED
rows.Comment:
A limit of an axis has been violated.  This can happen if a CP movement
is done too close to a singularity or if the path has a very high curvature.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_CONFIGS_DIFFER
rows.Comment:
The kinematic configuration of the start position differs from
the end position.  The CP movement would pass a
singularity.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_BUS_TASK_NOT_CALLED
rows.Comment:
This error is obsolete and is maintained only for compatibility.
If a CP-halt/-stop is commanded, some information has to be
transferred to the bus task. We expect this to happen
before the next cycle of the slow task.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_NO_ROOT_IN_INTERVAL_FOUND
rows.Comment:
The stop trajectory could not be found in the interval.
(internal error)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_KIN_DOES_NOT_SUPPORT_AXIS_ORIENTATION_IPO
rows.Comment:
The kinematics does not support the orientation mode
âAxisâ for continuous path movements.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_ORIENTATION_IPO_NOT_SUPPORTED_FOR_CPTR
rows.Comment:
The axis orientation interpolation mode is not supported
for CP movements with a dynamic PCS (tracking).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_PATH_ELEM
rows.Comment: An invalid path element has been created (internal error)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_TRANSITION_NOT_SMOOTH
rows.Comment:
The transition between two path elements is not G2 continuous,
and there is no stop (internal error)

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_ORIENTATION_IPO_CONFIG_DIFFERS
rows.Comment:
Axis orientation interpolation mode is used, but between
the start end end position, there is a singularity of the
position kinematics.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_ORIENTATION_IPO_OFFSET2_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
rows.Comment:
The position kinematics has configurations but does not
implement the interface ISMPositionKinematics_Offset2.
In this case, axis orientation interpolation is not
possible.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ROTARY_AXIS_PERIOD_MISMATCH
rows.Comment:
The target position of a rotary axis will not be reached
in the commanded period.
(E.g. the commanded target position
is -170Â°, but the target will be reached with position 190Â°
instead.)
This means that the chosen interpolation to the target position
is not compatible with the commanded position.
For PTP movements (MC_MoveDirect*), this error can happen if
the previous movement is a CP movement (MC_MoveLinear*,
MC_MoveCircular*), and if the CP movement is very long.
To avoid the problem, the CP movement should be divided
into two or more shorter movements.  The problem can occur
if a rotary axis has to move 360Â° or more during the CP
movement.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ROTARY_AXIS_RANGE_VIOLATION
rows.Comment:
A rotary axis has violated the allowed axis range during
a CP movement.  The CP movment is not in the working area.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_COMPUTE_TARGET_DISCONTINUITY
rows.Comment:
The target trajectory could not be computed due to a
discontinuity of the end position (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_TRAJECTORY_NOT_SMOOTH
rows.Comment:
The trajectory is not smooth, the phase end states do not
equal the the current state (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ERROR_CREATING_PARAM_TRANSFORM
rows.Comment:
A parameter transformation could not be created (internal
error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_PTP_DATA_NUMBER_OF_AXES
rows.Comment:
Error generating path-invariant PTP element (internal
error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_NEGATIVE_PATH_VELOCITY
rows.Comment:
Error while computing a new trajectory: the path velocity after
phase 1 (positive jerk of length dTau1) is negative (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_TRANSITIONING_FROM_SINGLE_AXIS_MOVEMENT_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
Transitioning from a single axis movement to a continuous path
movement is not supported.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_PLANNER_NO_PROGRESS
rows.Comment:
The CP-planner did not make any progress.  This is an internal error
That can be triggered by very sharp corners (e.g. blending between
short elements or with small corner distance).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INTERNAL_EVAL_CACHE_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the evaluation cache of the CP-planner.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_ROOT_ACC_TOO_HIGH
rows.Comment:
The acceleration at the trajectory end is too high for a
valid root (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_ROOT_TRAJECTORY_TOO_LARGE
rows.Comment:
The stop trajectory is too large. Reduce the velocity or
increase the acceleration and jerk limits.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_EMPTY_TRAJECTORY
rows.Comment:
The trajectory is empty, i.e. has no phases (internal
error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_FORECAST_TOO_LARGE
rows.Comment:
The forecast duration is too large given the configured planning
interval and sync buffer duration.
To avoid this error, either reduce the forecast duration, reduce the
sync buffer duration, or increase the planning interval.  See SMC_TuneCPKernel
for more details.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_INVALID_ROOT_ENDPOS_NOT_GREATER_STARTPOS
rows.Comment:
The end position of the trajectory is not greater than the
start position (internal error).

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_VELOCITY_LIMIT_EXCEEDED_WHITHOUT_MOVING
rows.Comment: Axis velocity limit exceeded whithout moving on the path.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_ACCELERATION_LIMIT_EXCEEDED_WHITHOUT_MOVING
rows.Comment:
Axis acceleration limit exceeded whithout moving on the
path.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_JERK_LIMIT_EXCEEDED_WHITHOUT_MOVING
rows.Comment: Axis jerk limit exceeded whithout moving on the path.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_AXIS_TORQUE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED_WHITHOUT_MOVING
rows.Comment:
Axis torque/force limit exceeded whithout moving on the
path.

rows.Name: SMC_GROUPJOG2_MAX_DISTANCE_NON_POSITIVE
rows.Comment:
Either MaxLinearDistance or MaxAngularDistance of
SMC_GroupJog2 is non-positive.

rows.Name: SMC_GROUPJOG2_DYNAMIC_CS_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
SMC_GroupJog2 does not support jogging in dynamic coordinate
systems.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_TOO_MANY_TRIGGERS_PREPARED
rows.Comment: Too many triggers have been prepared for the next movement.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_UNSUPPORTED_MOVEMENT_TYPE
rows.Comment:
Triggers for wait commands and for halt/stop commands are
not supported.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_INVALID_POS_TYPE
rows.Comment: The given trigger position type is not valid.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_RELATIVE_POSITION_OUT_OF_RANGE
rows.Comment: The relative trigger position must be in the range [-1, 1].

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_PLANE_NORMAL_NOT_A_UNIT
rows.Comment: The normal vector for a trigger plane must be a unit-vector.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_PLANE_DISTANCE_NEGATIVE
rows.Comment: The distance of the trigger plane must be non-negative.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_PLANE_COORD_SYSTEM_INVALID
rows.Comment:
The coordinate system of the trigger plane must not be ACS
or TCS.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_DISTANCE_OUT_OF_RANGE
rows.Comment:
The trigger distance must be in the range [-len, len], where len
is the length of the movement.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_PLANE_NO_INTERSECTION
rows.Comment: No intersection between the trigger plane and the movement.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_TRACKING_TRANSITION_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
Triggers not supported for tracking movements between different
coordinate systems.

rows.Name: SMC_TRIGGER_PTP_NOT_SUPPORTED
rows.Comment:
Triggers with position type MvtDistance and PlaneInstersection are
not supported for PTP movements.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_FULL
rows.Comment: The cam builder is full. No new cam segments can be added.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INVALID_MASTER_DISTANCE
rows.Comment: The master distance of a cam segment must be > 0.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_GAP_BETWEEN_SEGMENTS
rows.Comment:
The new segment does not connect to the master end position
of the previous segment.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_NO_IMPLICIT_LEFT_BOUNDARY_ALLOWED
rows.Comment:
No implicit left boundary allowed, because the last segment
has an implicit right boundary.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INVALID_IMPLICIT_CAM_SEGMENT_MASTER_DISTANCE
rows.Comment:
x0 of the new segment results in a master distance <=0 for
the previous implicit segment.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_CAM_REF_INSUFFICIENT_MEMORY
rows.Comment:
The cam builder has more segments than the MC_CAM_REF can
store.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_LAST_SEGMENT_HAS_IMPLICIT_RIGHT_BOUNDARY
rows.Comment: The last segment has an implicit right boundary.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INVALID_CAM_REF_INITIALIZATION
rows.Comment:
MC_CAM_REF init error, due to a null pointer to the cam
segments.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_ERROR_PENDING
rows.Comment:
The data of the cam builder cannot be written to the
MC_CAM_REF, because an error is pending.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_CONTINUITY_REQUIREMENT_VIOLATED
rows.Comment:
The continuity check of the cam builder detected a violated
continuity requirement.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_MASTER_DISTANCE_TOO_SHORT
rows.Comment: The master distance of the cam segment is too short.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_IMPLICIT_CAM_SEGMENT_DISTANCE_TOO_SHORT
rows.Comment:
The master distance of the previous implicit segment is too
short.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_CAM_REF_INVALID_ARRAY_SIZE
rows.Comment:
Array size is limited to 32767 SMC_CAM_SEGMENT entries and
must be a multiple of this data type.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_MODIFIED_SINE_INVALID_LAMBDA_OR_ACC_PARAM
rows.Comment:
The given lambda or acceleration parameter Ca* of this
segment is invalid.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_MODIFIED_SINE_ACC_PARAM_RIGHT_BOUND_IMPLICIT
rows.Comment:
A modified sine segment defined by the acceleration
parameter Ca* must not have an implicit right boundary.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INVALID_COMPILE_TYPE
rows.Comment: MC_CAM_REF has an unsupported compile type.

rows.Name: SMC_MOVEMENT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in a movement.

rows.Name: SMC_MOVEMENT_GET_POS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while trying to get a position in a movement.

rows.Name: SMC_CPTR_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the CPTR kernel.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_IPO_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while interpolating in the CP kernel.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_ADD_NEW_MOVEMENT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while adding a new movement to the CP kernel.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_COORDINATION_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while coordinating kernels.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_ADD_MOVEMENT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while adding movements to the axis group.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_READ_AXIS_STATES_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment:
Internal error while reading the state of one of the groupâs
axes.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_READ_VEL_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while trying to read the velocity.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_READ_ACC_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while trying to read the acceleration.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_INVALID_STATE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error: The axis group is in an invalid state.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_PCS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while handling a PCS.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_INTERRUPT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: An internal error occured during an interrupt.

rows.Name: SMC_CONTINUE_DATA_READ_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while reading continue data.

rows.Name: SMC_CONTINUE_DATA_WRITE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while writing continue data.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in a path element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_ESTIMATE_LIMITS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment:
Internal error while estimating the limits of a path
element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_ZERO_LEN_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in a zero-length path element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_BLEND_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in a blending element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_BLEND_GEO_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the geometric part of a path element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_BLEND_ORI_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the orientation part of a path element.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_BLEND_AS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in an axis space element.

rows.Name: SMC_ELEM_FUN_CART_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in an element function.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_HALT_STOP_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error during cp halt or stop.

rows.Name: SMC_TRJ_PLANNING_INIT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while initializing trajectory planning.

rows.Name: SMC_TRJ_PLANNING_GEN_SAMPLES_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while generating samples.

rows.Name: SMC_TRJ_PLANNING_PATH_OUT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while creating the output path.

rows.Name: SMC_TRJ_PLANNING_EVAL_AXIS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while evaluating axis values.

rows.Name: SMC_TRJ_PLANNING_LOOKAHEAD_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in planning lookahead.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_READ_JERK_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while trying to read the jerk.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_GROUP_WRITE_CONTINUE_POS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while writing the continue position.

rows.Name: SMC_CP_TRANSITION_CHECK_FAILED
rows.Comment:
Internal error while checking whether the path is
continuous.

rows.Name: SMC_ABORTING_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while aborting.

rows.Name: SMC_LINE_TO_REL_STANDSTILL_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while creating a line to relative standstill.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_POSE_EVAL_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error while evaluating a pose on a path element.

rows.Name: SMC_CS_REF_COUNT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in coordinate system reference counting.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_QUEUE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the path queue.

rows.Name: SMC_PATH_ELEM_QUEUE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the path queue.

rows.Name: SMC_ELEM_FUN_QUEUE_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the element function queue.

rows.Name: SMC_MAC_DUPLICATE_CALLER_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment:
Internal error in the multi acyclic communicator due to a
duplicate SDO caller.

rows.Name: SMC_MAC_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the multi acyclic communicator.

rows.Name: SMC_READ_POSITION_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error when reading the axis group position.

rows.Name: SMC_ELEM_FUN_PROJECT_POINT_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in function GeoPrim_ProjectPoint

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_EVAL_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error during cam table evaluation

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INTERNAL_ERROR_INVALID_CAM_SEGMENT_TYPE
rows.Comment: Internal error when evaluating the cam segment type.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INTERNAL_ERROR_INVALID_DESCRIPTION_TYPE
rows.Comment:
Internal error when evaluating the cam segment description
type.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INTERNAL_ERROR_IMPLICIT_BOUNDARY_CANNOT_BE_EVALUATED
rows.Comment: Internal error when trying to evaluate an implicit boundary.

rows.Name: SMC_CAM_BUILDER_INTERNAL_ERROR_OUT_OF_BOUNDS
rows.Comment:
Internal error when trying to access cam segments out of
bounds.

rows.Name: SMC_AXIS_MOVEMENTS_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in the axis movements.

rows.Name: SMC_STOP_INTERNAL_ERROR
rows.Comment: Internal error in MC_Stop.
